content: complete the corner on 1st short side & on each corner piece throughout on each short side make 18 single_crochet across short ends evenly spaced 2 single_crochet to shape corner on opposite long side using the remaining loop of each chain 1sc to end of round slip_stitch in top of ch1 shaping the neckwarmer fold the rectangular piece to create a center point refer to photo 1 this will also create an overlapping square on the back side refer to photos below using stitch markers or safety pins secure the positioning to prevent shift during next rnds photo 2 shaping note the safety pins also note area with red lines will not be worked in round 2 - 7 below note this is a good point to make sure you have 111 stitches which is divisible by 3 or if you have a different size hook or yarn ensure that your stitch count can be divided by 3 examples 96 / 3 = 32 111 / 3 = 37 114 / 3= 38 117 / 3 = 39 doing this now allows for project increase or decrease as needed in next 2 rnds round 2 in this round work through all thicknesses of the outer edges not the inner neck area ch1 single_crochet in 1st single_crochet * single_crochet in next single_crochet *repeat to last st on round slip_stitch in top of ch1 round 3 repeat round 2 round 4 ch3 counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet ch2 2dc in 1st single_crochet skip next 3 single_crochet * 2dc ch2 2dc in next single_crochet skip 3 single_crochet * repeat until 4 sts remain skip 3sc & slip_stitch in top of ch3 round 5 - 7 skip 1st double_crochet slip_stitch in 1st ch2 space working in same ch2 space ch3 double_crochet ch2 2dc working in each ch2 space in the round * 2dc ch2 2dc to end of round slip_stitch in top of ch3 add more rnds if desired end off weave in loose ends add embelishments or buttons as desired this design was created and crocheted by pamela mazzola rebecca swan-byrd was kind enough to create this written pattern of my design for me so i can share this with all my fellow crochet lovers many thanks to her this pattern has not been tested
